name: (2E)-2-phenyl-3-(phenylamino)prop-2-enenitrile
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-925
Reason:
The compound (2E)-2-phenyl-3-(phenylamino)prop-2-enenitrile can be broken down into the contributions of its functional groups to predict its melting point: 
- Basic unit, benzene has a melting point of 5.5°C. 
- Phenyl group: adds significantly since it introduces a rigid and planar structure, which increases the melting point due to increased intermolecular forces. An educated estimate for this effect is +50°C to +70°C. 
- Nitrile group (-CN): adds to the melting point due to its electronegativity and the polarizability of the nitrogen atom, which increases intermolecular forces. An estimated effect could be around +10°C to +15°C due to the polar nature of the C-N bond. 
- Phenylamino group: adds to the melting point due to its electronegativity and the polarizability of the nitrogen atom, which increases intermolecular forces. An estimated effect could be around +10°C to +15°C due to the polar nature of the C-N bond. 
- Trans isomer: tends to have a higher melting point compared to the cis isomer due to better packing in the solid state. The effect can be estimated at around +5°C. 
Considering these adjustments, the values are summation of the estimated effects.
